title: Analytics Components Guide
description: Learn about the different components that Adobe Analytics offers.

title: Dimensions overview
description: Variables that contain string values.

title: Analytics Dimensions Compatibility
description: Reference for Analytics dimensions and reports.

title: All search page rank
description: Determine which page on a search engine a visitor clicked through to your site.

title: AM/PM
description: Determines if the hit happened during AM or PM hours.

title: Browser height - bucketed
description: The height of the browser window in pixels.

title: Browser type
description: The organization that made the browser.

title: Browser width - bucketed
description: The width of the browser window in pixels.

title: Browser
description: The name and version of the browser used.

title: Campaigns
description: Disambiguation page.

title: Category
description: The product category of the hit.

title: Cities
description: The city where the hit originated from.

title: Color depth
description: The color depth of the device.

title: Connection type
description: How the visitor connects to the internet.

title: Cookie support
description: Determines if the browser supports cookies.

title: Countries
description: The country where the hit originated from.

title: Custom link
description: The name of the custom link.

title: Customer loyalty
description: Categories based on the number of previous purchases a visitor has made.

title: Day of month
description: The numeric day of the month, regardless of which month.

title: Day of week
description: The day of the week, regardless of date range.

title: Day of year
description: The numeric day of the year, regardless of which year.

title: Day
description: The day that the metric occurred on.

title: Days before first purchase
description: The number of days between a visitor's first visit and their first purchase.

title: Days since last purchase
description: The number of days between the current hit and the last purchase that they made.

title: Days since last visit
description: The number of days between the current hit and the last time they visited.

title: Domain
description: The organization or ISP the visitor uses to access the internet.

title: Download link
description: The name of the download link.

title: Entry dimensions
description: Lists entry dimensions and their use.

title: eVar
description: A custom dimension you can use in reporting.

title: eVar (Merchandising)
description: Custom variables that tie to the products dimension.

title: Exit dimensions
description: Lists exit dimensions and their use.

title: Exit link
description: The name of the exit link.

title: First touch channel
description: The first marketing channel within the visitor's engagement expiration.

title: First touch channel detail
description: Details for the first marketing channel within the visitor's engagement expiration.

title: Hit depth
description: The number of hits into the visit.

title: Hit type
description: Determines if the hit was a foreground or background hit.

title: Hour of day
description: The numeric hour of the day, regardless of which day.

title: Hour
description: The hour that the metric occurred on.

title: Identified state
description: A flag determining recognition by the device graph.

title: Java enabled
description: Determines if Java is enabled in the browser.

title: Language
description: The preferred language setting in the browser.

title: Last touch channel
description: The most recent marketing channel within the visitor's engagement expiration.

title: Last touch channel detail
description: Details for the most recent marketing channel within the visitor's engagement expiration.

title: Marketing channel
description: The most recent marketing channel within the visitor's engagement expiration.

title: Marketing channel detail
description: The most recent marketing channel detail within the visitor's engagement expiration.

title: Minute
description: The minute that the metric occurred on.

title: Mobile dimensions
description: Dimensions based on the IP address of the device.

title: Monitor resolution
description: The resolution of the visitor's monitor in pixels.

title: Month of year
description: The numeric month of the year, regardless of which year.

title: Month
description: The month that the metric occurred on.

title: Operating system types
description: The operating system regardless of version.

title: Operating system
description: The operating system of the visitor.

title: Original referring domain
description: The first referring domain a visitor was on before clicking through to your site.

title: Page URL
description: The URL of the page.

title: Page
description: The name of the page.

title: Pages not found
description: URLs that returned an error on your site.

title: Paid search
description: Distinguishes metrics from paid and natural search.

title: Persistent cookie support
description: Determines if the visitor has the ability to support persistent cookies.

title: Product
description: The name of the product.

title: Prop
description: A custom dimension you can use in reporting.

title: Quarter of year
description: The numeric quarter of the year, regardless of which year.

title: Quarter
description: The quarter that the metric occurred on.

title: Referrer type
description: The type of referrer, depending on where the visitor came from.

title: Referrer
description: The URL a visitor was at before clicking through to your site.

title: Referring domain
description: The overarching domain a visitor was on before clicking through to your site.

title: Regions
description: The geographic region of the visitor.

title: Return frequency
description: The bucketed amount of time between the current visit and previous visit.

title: Search engine
description: The search engine that the visitor used to reach your site.

title: Search keyword
description: The search keyword that the visitor used to reach your site.

title: Server
description: The name of the server.

title: Single page visits
description: A flag indicating that the visit consisted of a single page.

title: Site section
description: The name of the site section.

title: Time prior to event
description: The amount of time between the metric and the first hit of the visit.

title: Time spent on page
description: The amount of time a visitor spent on the page.

title: Time spent per visit
description: The total amount of time the visit took.

title: Tracking Code
description: The name of the tracking code or campaign.

title: Tracking opt-out reason
description: Indicates if cookies were disabled by a desktop or mobile browser.

title: US DMA
description: The designated market area of the hit.

title: US states
description: The US state of the visitor.

title: Visit depth
description: Visit-based dimension that reports the depth of the visit.

title: Visit number
description: The nth visit of the visitor.

title: Week
description: The week that the metric occurred on.

title: Weekday/Weekend
description: Determines if the hit happened during a weekday or a weekend.

title: Year
description: The year that the metric occurred on.

title: Zip code
description: The zip code of the visitor.

title: Metrics overview
description: View quantities of dimension items or data over time.

title: Average page depth
description: How many pages in on average the dimension exists at.

title: Average page views per visit
description: The average number of times a given dimension item appeared in a visit.

title: Average session length (mobile)
description: The average session length for the mobile device.

title: Average time  on site
description: The average amount of time a given dimension item existed between hits.

title: Bounce rate
description: The ratio of visits with exactly one hit over entries.

title: Bounces
description: The number of visits with exactly one hit.

title: Cart additions
description: The number of hits where a visitor added a product to their cart.

title: Cart removals
description: The number of hits where a visitor removed a product from their cart.

title: Cart views
description: The number of hits where a visitor viewed their cart.

title: Carts
description: The number of hits where a visitor added their first product to a cart.

title: Checkouts
description: The number of hits where a visitor started the checkout process.

title: Content Velocity
description: Content Velocity measures the impact of content on downstream content.

title: Custom events
description: The number of hits where a custom event exists.

title: Entries
description: An instance of the first value in a visit.

title: Exits
description: An instance of the last value in a visit.

title: Instances
description: The number of hits that a variable was set (and not persisted).

title: Mobile views
description: Decommissioned metric; no longer used.

title: New engagements
description: The number of times a first touch channel is set.

title: Occurrences
description: The number of hits that a variable was set or persisted.

title: Orders per visit
description: The ratio of orders over visits.

title: Orders
description: The number of purchases made.

title: Page events
description: The number of link tracking actions triggered.

title: Page Views Metric Explained | Adobe Analytics
description: Learn how the page views metric is worked out in Adobe Analytics and also understand the difference between page views and visits.

title: Pages not found
description: The number of hits containing an error.

title: People
description: The number of unique individuals, typically with multiple devices.

title: Product views
description: The number of views to product pages.

title: Reloads
description: The number of times the page was reloaded.

title: Revenue
description: The monetary amount of products purchased within all orders.

title: Searches
description: The number of times a hit matched external search criteria.

title: Single access
description: The number of times a dimension item did not change in a visit.

title: Single page visits
description: The number of times that the 'Page' dimension item did not change in a visit.

title: Time spent per visit
description: The amount of time spent per visit for the dimension item.

title: Time spent per visitor (seconds)
description: The 'Time spent per visitor (seconds)' metric shows the average amount of time that visitors interact with a given dimension item during a visitor's entire lifetime.

title: How Time Spent is calculated in Adobe Analytics
description: An aggregated page of time spent dimensions and metrics.

title: Total seconds spent
description: The aggregated total number of seconds spent on the dimension item.

title: Unique devices
description: The number of unique devices.

title: Unique visitors
description: The number of unique visitor ID's.

title: Units
description: The total number of products purchased within all orders.

title: Visitors with Experience Cloud ID
description: The number of unique visitors using the Adobe Experience Cloud ID service.

title: Visits
description: A sequence of page views in a sitting.

title: Analytics segmentation
description: Adobe Analytics lets you build, manage, share, and apply powerful, focused audience segments to your reports using Analytics capabilities, the Adobe Experience Cloud, Adobe Target, and other integrated Adobe products.

title: About segments and containers
description: Segments allow you to identify subsets of visitors based on characteristics or website interactions. Segments are designed as codified audience insights that you can build for your specific needs, and then verify, edit, and share with other team members or use in other Adobe products and Analytics capabilities.

title: Segmentation features in Analysis Workspace
description: Learn about segmentation features in Analysis Workspace.

title: Segmentation workflow overview
description: Describes a suggested workflow for segments created with the Segment Builder and managed through the Segment Manager.

title: Plan segments
description: Outlines the steps and best practices to follow when planning your segments.

title: Build segments
description: The Segment Builder provides a canvas to drag and drop Metric Dimensions, Segments, and Events to segment visitors based on container hierarchy logic, rules, and operators. This integrated development tool lets you build and save simple or complex segments that identify visitor attributes and actions across visits and page hits.

title: Build sequential segments
description: Sequential segments are created by using the THEN operator, instead of AND or OR. THEN implies that one segment criteria occurs, followed by another. By default, a sequential segment identifies all matching data, showing the filter "Include Everyone". Sequential segments can be further filtered to a subset of matching hits using the "Only Before Sequence" and "Only After Sequence" options.

title: Tag segments
description: In the Segment Manager, tagging segments allows you to organize them.

title: Approve segments
description: Within the Segment Manager you can set up a workflow that includes approving segments for various levels of application, for specific departments or groups, and consistent with reporting policies.

title: Share segments
description: Depending on your permissions, you can share segments with your whole organization, groups, or individual users.

title: Publish segments to the Experience Cloud
description: Lets you use the segment for marketing activity in the Audience Library, Target, and Audience Manager.

title: Select and apply segments
description: How to apply one or more segments to a report from the segment rail.

title: Filter segments
description: Filter by tags, owners, and other filters (Show All, Mine, Shared With me, Favorites, and Approved.)

title: Mark segments as favorites
description: Marking segments as favorites is another way to organize them for ease of use.

title: Delete segments
description: Lists a few considerations you should be aware of before deleting segments.

title: Manage segments
description: The Segment Manager offers many ways of curating segments, such as sharing, filtering, tagging, approving, copying, deleting, and marking as favorites.

title: Comparison Operators for Segments
description: The Segment Builder allows you to compare and constrain values using selected operators.

title: Data Warehouse Segment Compatibility
description: Not all segments created in the Segment Builder are compatible with Data Warehouse. This table lists the supported functions.

title: Segment Rights by Role
description: Segment functionality now mostly differs between Admin-level users and non-Admins.

title: Segmentation Troubleshooting
description: Troubleshoot and fix issues related to segments.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
description: Frequently asked questions around segmentation.

title: Segmentation best practices
description: Create optimal segments that return data efficiently.

title: Calculated and Advanced Calculated (Derived) Metrics
description: Calculated and Advanced Calculated (or Derived) Metrics are custom metrics that you can create from existing metrics.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
description: These changes to the way calculated metrics work in Analytics may impact you.

title: How-to videos
description: These short videos (8 minutes or less) provide an overview of how to optimize the use of the Calculated Metric tools.

title: Calculated metrics workflow
description: Learn about the steps to take for creating calculated metrics.

title: Find metrics
description: Describes the two main ways of finding your metrics  sorting and filtering.

title: Build Metrics
description: The Calculated Metrics Builder provides a canvas to drag and drop Dimensions, Metrics, Segments, and Functions to create custom metrics based on container hierarchy logic, rules, and operators. This integrated development tool lets you build and save simple calculated metrics or complex advanced calculated metrics.

title: Metric Type and Attribution
description: Learn about

title: Build a simple "Page Views per Visits" metric
description: Shows how to build a simple "Page Views per Visits" metric.

title: Segmented metrics
description: Segmenting on individual metrics allows you to make metric comparisons within the same report.

title: Stack and replace segments
description: Shows how to stack and replace segments within the Calculated Metric Builder.

title: Filtered and weighted metrics
description: Shows examples of filtered and weighted metrics.

title: Order Assists Metric
description: Explains how to create a metric that shows which Marketing Channels assist in driving orders. This can be adapted to any dimension or success event of interest.

title: Use functions
description: Functions let you filter/sort your data and do statistical analysis.

title: Participation Metric
description: With the Calculated Metric builder, anyone can create a participation metric.

title: Tag calculated metrics
description: In the Calculated Metric Manager, tagging segments allows you to organize them.

title: Approve calculated metrics
description: Within the Calculated Metric Manager, you can set up a workflow that includes approving metrics for various levels of application and for specific departments or groups.

title: Share calculated metrics
description: Depending on your permissions, you can share metrics with your whole organization, groups, or individual users.

title: Calculated Metric Manager
description: The Calculated Metric Manager offers many ways of curating metrics, such as sharing, filtering, tagging, approving, copying, deleting, and marking as favorites.

title: Reference  basic functions
description: The Calculated Metrics Builder lets you apply statistical and mathematical functions to build Advanced Calculated Metrics.

title: Reference  advanced functions
description: Access these functions by checking Show Advanced in the Functions drop-down list.

title: Metric compatibility
description: Explains the three Product Compatibility options.

title: Calculated metrics  role-based rights
description: Calculated metrics rights differs between Admin-level users and non-Admins.

title: Calculated metrics totals
description: Learn how calculated metrics totals differ in Analytics tools

title: Virtual report suites overview
description: Virtual report suites segment your Adobe Analytics data so you can control access to each segment.

title: Virtual Report Suite Component Curation
description: Virtual report suites can be curated to include and exclude components.in Analysis Workspace.

title: VRS support in Mobile Services
description: The Adobe Mobile Services UI combines mobile app data from your Adobe Analytics report suites with the ability to send push notifications and generate in-app messages.

title: Context-aware sessions
description: Context-aware sessions in virtual report suites change how Adobe Analytics calculates mobile visits. This article describes the processing implications of background hits and app launch events (both set by the mobile SDK) to how mobile visits are defined.

title: Report time processing
description: Report time processing is a virtual report suite setting that allows data to be processed in a non-destructive, retroactive fashion.

title: VRS FAQs
description: Tips and Best Practices for new users of virtual report suites.

title: Virtual report suites and multi-suite tagging considerations
description: Virtual report suites and multi-suite tagging have different advantages. Learn which is best for your organization.

title: Virtual report suite workflow
description: An overview of the steps required to plan an implement virtual report suites.

title: Create virtual report suites
description: Before you start creating virtual report suites, here are a few things to keep in mind.

title: Manage virtual report suites
description: The Virtual Report Suite Manager lets Administrators edit, add, tag, delete, rename, approve, copy, export, and filter virtual report suites. It is not visible to non-Admin users.

title: View virtual report suite information
description: Click the i (Info) icon next to the report suite name to get info about it.

title: Cross-Device Analytics
description: Change your data from device-focused to person-focused by stitching device data together.

title: Field-based stitching
description: Understand the prerequisites and limitations of stitching data using field-based stitching.

title: Device graph
description: Understand the prerequisites and limitations of stitching data using the device graph.

title: Set up Cross-Device Analytics
description: Configure a virtual report suite to enable CDA.

title: How replays work
description: Understand the concept of "replay" in Cross-Device Analytics

title: CDA Workspace template
description: Describes each field in the CDA template within Analysis Workspace.

title: Limit a VRS to certain dates
description: Understand how to limit a VRS date range to focus on stitched data only.

title: Cross-Device Analytics FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions for Cross-Device Analytics

title: Intelligent alerts
description: The new Intelligent Alerts system allows for more granular control over alerts and integrates anomaly detection with the alert system.

title: Alert Builder
description: Use alerts in Analysis Workspace.

title: Alert Manager
description: Manage alerts.

title: Intelligent alerts - use cases
description: Use cases for creating and managing intelligent alerts.

title: Classifications overview
description: Customize the grouping of dimension items.

title: Classifications importer - overview
description: Use the importer to upload classifications into Adobe Analytics. You can also export the data for updating prior to an import.

title: Classification data files
description: The importer lets you bulk-upload classifications data to analytics reporting in a file. The import requires a specific file format for successful data uploads.

title: Delete classification data
description: Steps that describe how to delete or remove classification data.

title: Escape classification data
description: Steps that describe how to escape classification data in the classification file.

title: Non-classified keys
description: Non-classified keys are grouped together in classification reports as a single line item labeled None. It can be useful to rename None to something more descriptive.

title: Classification template
description: (Optional) Before importing classifications into marketing reports, you can download a template that helps you create a classifications data file. The data file uses your desired classifications as column headings, then organizes the reporting data set under the appropriate classification headings.

title: Browser and FTP import
description: After you have copied the appropriate data into the classifications template file, you can import (upload) into Adobe data collection servers.

title: Browser import
description: You can import (upload) classifications data using the browser. This method limits your classification data upload to a single report suite

title: FTP import
description: Steps that describe how to upload data files via FTP.

title: Classification importer processing time
description: Understand the time frame Adobe processes classification files, and how to minimize processing time.

title: Classification importer troubleshooting
description: Common upload issues when using the classification importer.

title: Classification Rule Builder workflow
description: Rather than maintaining and uploading classifications each time your tracking codes change, you can create automatic, rule-based classifications and apply them across multiple report suites. Rules are processed at frequent intervals, depending on your volume of classification related traffic.

title: Classification rule sets
description: A rule set is a group of classification rules for a specific variable. You apply a variable to the rule set. If you want to create multiple rule sets for one variable, you must apply each rule set to multiple report suites.

title: Classification rules
description: Classification rules regularly look for unclassified terms. If a rule match is found, the rules add the terms to your classification data tables automatically. You can also use classification rules to overwrite existing keys.

title: Classification rules - definitions
description: Definitions of interface elements on the pages in the Classification Rule Builder.

title: Sub-classifications and the Rule Builder
description: You cannot combine the Classification Rule Builder with sub-classifications.

title: About sub-classifications
description: Adobe Analytics support both single-level and multiple-level classifications models. A classification hierarchy allows you to apply a classification to a classification.

title: Classifications FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions for using classifications.

title: Calendar events
description: Steps to add calendar events, and to manage shared events.

title: Real-time reporting overview
description: Displays web page traffic and ranks page views in real time. Provides actionable data to base your business decisions on.

title: Configure real-time reports
description: Administrative steps for setting up Real-Time reports.

title: Supported real-time metrics and dimensions
description: Lists metrics and dimensions supported by Real-Time reports. Classifications are also supported, if you have defined them.

title: Get Started with Marketing Channels
description: Learn about the Marketing Channels workflow, the automatic setup, and how to apply template report suite settings to multiple report suites.

title: Manage marketing channels
description: Add or enable marketing channels in the Marketing Channel Manager. For report suites that have no marketing channels, an automatic setup lets you create several channels for you, along with their rules. You can edit predefined channels to suit your needs, or create your own (up to a total of 25).

title: Processing rules for Marketing Channels
description: Marketing Channel processing rules determine if a visitor hit meets the criteria assigned to a channel. The rules process every hit a visitor makes on your site. When a rule does not meet the criteria for a channel, or if rules are not configured correctly, the system assigns the hit to No Channel Identified.

title: Classifications in Marketing Channels
description: Use classifications to categorize values into related groups and to report at the group level. For example, you can classify all Paid Search campaigns into a category like Video Cards. Then you can report on the success of that category relative to metrics like Instances (or click-throughs).

title: Marketing channel expiration
description: Learn how to specify visitor engagement expiration in Marketing Channels.

title: Analyze Marketing Channels
description: Learn how to use Marketing Channels dimensions in Workspace.

title: Marketing Channel permissions
description: Describes how to run the Marketing Channel report, grant limited admin user rights, and user group permissions to report.

title: Marketing Channels FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions for Marketing channels.
